Participants.evidence: This retrospective cohort study included consecutive patients who underwent fluoroscopy-guided foam sclerotherapy for varicose veins in the legs at the authors’ center during a period from August 1, 2011, to May 31, 2016.

Intervention.evidence: fluoroscopy-guided foam sclerotherapy for varicose veins in the legs

Objective.evidence: Objective: To examine the long-term effectiveness of fluoroscopy-guided foam sclerotherapy for varicose veins in the legs.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The final analysis included 94 patients (58.3 ± 7.8 years of age; 43 men; 119 legs).

Number_Analysed.evidence: The final analysis included 94 patients (58.3 ± 7.8 years of age; 43 men; 119 legs).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The recurrence rate was 30.9% (29/94) in the overall analysis, 26.6% (25/94) for the great saphenous vein and 4.3% (4/94) for the small saphenous vein ( P < .001).

Harms.evidence: No patients developed stroke, deep vein thrombosis, or pulmonary embolism after the treatment.
